newsitem.title: GERMANY: Jil Sander sees 1997 oper profit steady.
newsitem.headline: Jil Sander sees 1997 oper profit steady.

text.p: German fashion group Jil Sander AG said on Friday it expected operating profit for 1997 to remain at about the same level as in 1996.

The company, the women's fashion group founded and operated by designer Jil Sander, said 1996 net profit fell to 11.1 million marks from 12.4 million marks although sales climbed 5.8 percent to 172.7 million marks.
Jil Sander also said it would keep steady its dividend on ordinary shares for 1996 at 25 marks.
The company attributed the higher sales to increased demand in North America and the Asia-Pacific region as part of efforts to strengthen international brand awareness.
